author: potuz
content: As far as I can see, any particular hack is completely irrelevant. The point is that the entire space is riddled with bad actors/scammers in the worst case or just sloppy/inexperienced/overly excited devs. Until there's some critical mass of people that know what they're doing and at the same time there is more accumulated knowledge of known hacks, it seems to me that the very least these companies should be doing is try a little less to be the first ones implementing something and a little more to be the first implementing it right.

author: johngog
content: While I'm sad to see money being stolen, I believe market forces will eventually clear this up. Just like choosing brand name versus bargain basement insurance company, at some point 600 million won't easily flow into projects without track records/audits/etc... People investing will have correlated the high rewards with the extreme risk.
